headline: 3 Stocks Under $50 Walking a Fine Line
summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

content.title: 3 Stocks Under $50 Walking a Fine Line
content.summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

headline: Warner Bros. Dismisses Latest Paramount Bid as Inadequate
summary: The media company’s board of directors said in a letter to shareholders Wednesday that Paramount’s offer provides insufficient value and that it has doubts that Paramount will be able to close the deal.  Paramount had put forth a revised offer Dec. 22 that reiterated a plan to buy shares at $30 apiece but included a higher break-up fee and an assurance from billionaire Larry Ellison that he would personally guarantee $40.4 billion in equity financing backing the deal.

content.title: Warner Bros. Dismisses Latest Paramount Bid as Inadequate
content.summary: The media company’s board of directors said in a letter to shareholders Wednesday that Paramount’s offer provides insufficient value and that it has doubts that Paramount will be able to close the deal.  Paramount had put forth a revised offer Dec. 22 that reiterated a plan to buy shares at $30 apiece but included a higher break-up fee and an assurance from billionaire Larry Ellison that he would personally guarantee $40.4 billion in equity financing backing the deal.

headline: Netflix Supports Warner Bros. Discovery Board's Commitment to Merger Agreement
summary: Netflix, Inc. today welcomed the Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) Board of Directors' continued commitment to the merger agreement between Netflix and WBD, and its unanimous recommendation that stockholders reject the revised offer from Paramount Skydance Corporation (PSKY), announced December 22, 2025.

content.title: Netflix Supports Warner Bros. Discovery Board's Commitment to Merger Agreement
content.summary: Netflix, Inc. today welcomed the Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) Board of Directors' continued commitment to the merger agreement between Netflix and WBD, and its unanimous recommendation that stockholders reject the revised offer from Paramount Skydance Corporation (PSKY), announced December 22, 2025.

headline: WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS SHAREHOLDERS REJECT AMENDED PARAMOUNT TENDER OFFER
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("Warner Bros. Discovery" or "WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board") has unanimously determined that Paramount Skydance's ("PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) tender offer, as amended on December 22, 2025, is not in the best interests of WBD and its shareholders and does not meet the criteria of a "Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. ("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX) announced on December 5, 2025.

content.title: WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS SHAREHOLDERS REJECT AMENDED PARAMOUNT TENDER OFFER

("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX) announced on December 5, 2025.

headline: Warner Bros rejects revised Paramount bid as risky leveraged buyout
summary:
STORY: Warner Bros Discovery's board has turned down Paramount Skydance's latest hostile bid.

They called the revised $108.4 billion offer a risky leveraged buyout and advised investors to reject it.

The board sent a letter to shareholders on Wednesday (January 7).

It said Paramount's offer relies on - quote - "an extraordinary amount of debt financing" that raises the risk of closing.

The board also confirmed its commitment to an $82.7 billion deal with Netflix.

The streaming giant wants to buy the Warner Bros film and television studio and other assets.

A buyout would mean new owners get hold of entertainment franchises like "Harry Potter", and the DC Comics universe.

The Warner Bros board argued Paramount's financing plan would leave the smaller Hollywood studio with $87 billion in debt once the acquisition closed.

That would make it the largest leveraged buyout in history. 

Paramount proposed to use $40 billion in equity personally guaranteed by Oracle's billionaire co-founder Larry Ellison.

It also pitched $54 billion in debt to finance the deal.

But Warner Bros still sees this as inadequate.

Netflix welcomed the decision on Wednesday.

It said their deal was the superior proposal that will deliver the greatest value to stockholders and the entertainment industry.

Paramount didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.

content.title: Warner Bros rejects revised Paramount bid as risky leveraged buyout

headline: Warner Bros rejects updated Paramount takeover bid, backs Netflix deal

content.title: Warner Bros rejects updated Paramount takeover bid, backs Netflix deal
content.summary: The board of entertainment and news giant Warner Bros.Three days later, Paramount launched an all-cash tender offer valuing the entertainment giant at $108.4 billion.

thumbnail.caption: The bidding war over Warner Bros that will reshape Hollywood and US media has drawn White House attention, and is likely to face major regulatory scrutiny (Robyn Beck)

headline: Warner Bros shareholders urged to reject amended Paramount bid
summary: The board of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) has urged its shareholders to reject an amended hostile bid by Paramount Skydance while maintaining its unanimous support for a rival offer by Netflix.  A letter to investors said the updated $108.4bn all-cash offer from Paramount, for the whole business, involved an "extraordinary amount of debt financing" that represented a risk to any deal completing.  Paramount's bid was hostile, through a direct approach to WBD's shareholders, as the board had already thrown its weight behind the $72bn ($54bn) cash and stock offer made by Netflix in early December.

content.title: Warner Bros shareholders urged to reject amended Paramount bid
content.summary: The board of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) has urged its shareholders to reject an amended hostile bid by Paramount Skydance while maintaining its unanimous support for a rival offer by Netflix.  A letter to investors said the updated $108.4bn all-cash offer from Paramount, for the whole business, involved an "extraordinary amount of debt financing" that represented a risk to any deal completing.  Paramount's bid was hostile, through a direct approach to WBD's shareholders, as the board had already thrown its weight behind the $72bn ($54bn) cash and stock offer made by Netflix in early December.

headline: Warner Bros rejects takeover offer from Paramount, tells shareholders to stick with Netflix bid
summary: Warner Bros. again rejected a takeover bid from Paramount and told shareholders Wednesday to stick with a rival offer from Netflix.  Warner’s leadership has repeatedly rebuffed Skydance-owned Paramount’s overtures — and urged shareholders just weeks ago to back its the sale of its streaming and studio business to Netflix for $72 billion.  Paramount, meanwhile, has sweetened its $77.9 billion offer for the entire company and gone straight to shareholders with a hostile bid.

content.title: Warner Bros rejects takeover offer from Paramount, tells shareholders to stick with Netflix bid

Paramount, meanwhile, has sweetened its $77.9 billion offer for the entire company and gone straight to shareholders with a hostile bid.

headline: WBD rejects Paramount Skydance bid, Strategy pops, Discord IPO
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) rejecting the latest Paramount Skydance (PSKY) bid, Strategy (MSTR) shares are rising after MSCI shelved a plan to exclude digital asset-backed treasuries from its indexes, and Bloomberg is reporting that Discord (DISO.PVT) has confidentially filed for an initial public offering. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
